University of California, Riverside
          

               Alfonso Maldonado '13, who came to the U.S. when he was 5 from Michoacan, Mexico, used to worry he might not come home from work visiting detained clients at the Adelanto ICE Processing Center.

               Gifts to UC Riverside enrich our ability to shape the lives of future generations of leaders and provide a robust teaching and learning experience. We are Living the Promise – join us!

title: Campus Emergency Status: Home
body:
You are here:
   

       Search for:
      





       No Restrictions.
       

       The campus conducts an Alertus Bell Tower Speaker Calibration Test on the First Friday of the month at at 12:00PM (NOON). During this time you will hear multiple tones periodically from the Bell Tower. These will be loud steady sirens and "whoop-whoop" sounds that vary in intensity and type, some with verbal instructions. UC Riverside is committed to providing a safe and secure environment to all campus stakeholders. An important aspect of this commitment is ongoing testing and refinement of the various communications technologies, systems, and processes used during emergencies.
      

        Note:
       
       Testing of the campus emergency communications systems takes place on a reoccurring basis. Results of the most recent survey can be viewed through the
       
        Emergency Communications system effectiveness
        
         report
        

       . For additional information (i.e., what to do when you hear the Emergency Warning Siren), refer to the "Take Action" section of this webpage, or contac
       
        t
        
         emergency@ucr.edu
        

       .

title: Welcome to Highlander Day 2019 at University of California, Riverside - Saturday, April 6, 2019 at 10 a.m.
body:
Come see why so many students follow their hearts to UCR!
        

        Join us for the Highlander Day — an open house for admitted and prospective students and their families to learn more about our welcoming and diverse campus community.
       
        Connect with friendly faculty and current UCR students. Take up to five unique campus tours. And attend college sessions to find out how we will help you turn your passions into purpose!
       
        Check back for updates, including the Highlander Day agenda.
       

       Parking is free in Lot 30.
      
      On the day of the event, please follow the large directional signs for Highlander Day parking. Be sure to wear comfortable shoes and clothing.
     
      Check back for updates for next year's Highlander Day event.
     
          Yes. Please let us know that you will be attending and how many guests you will be bringing with you. You can provide your reservation when the registration form becomes available online.
         
          Yes, you can register as a group in the reservation form.
          

          While it's not a requirement for you to show up at 10 a.m., please keep in mind that the first session will begin promptly at 10 a.m. Most sessions will not be repeated. Your best bet is to take a look at the event's agenda when one becomes available, and plan your day from there.
         

           Highlander Day will go on rain or shine.
          
          All presentations listed on the agenda are conducted indoors. The safety of our guests and UCR personnel is most important, so outdoor programing could change or be cancelled at the last minute due to weather conditions.
         
          Yes, but please note that content is specific to each college. For example, only majors in the College of Natural and Agricultural Sciences (CNAS) will be discussed at CNAS sessions.
         
          Because UCR is a selective campus and majors are impacted, it is best to contact your admissions counselor as soon as possible to see about changing your major, particularly if you are thinking about moving to a different college within the university.
         
          Highlander Day is a way for you to learn about the campus, the student experience and the college to which you were admitted. If you are unsure about your major, we can help you explore the many options. For additional information about majors and minors, visit
          

            admissions.ucr.edu/academics
           

          .
         
          Highlander Day also offers presentations from faculty, staff and students, as well as campus/housing tours, department open houses, lunch at the Highlander Union Building (HUB), all-day entertainment, and more!
         
          An agenda will be released as we get closer to the event date.
         

           UNDERGRADUATE ADMISSIONS
          

      © 2019 University of California, Riverside. All rights reserved.
     

       UC Riverside complies with the Jeanne Clery Act, and provides safety information and publishes crime statistics for the most-recent three-year period.
       

         View the full report here
        

       .
       
       This information is accurate and reliable as of the date of publication, but may change without notice. Please contact Undergraduate Admissions for the most up-to-date information.

title: Enhancing the Staff Experience at UCR | Staff Assembly
body:
University of California, Riverside
              

              Many Talents, One Mission
             
                      UCR Staff Assembly is an association of employees dedicated to promoting the interests and welfare of all UCR staff. It seeks to inform, involve, connect and recognize staff in one of the fastest growing campuses in the UC system.
                     
                        UCR Staff Assembly is built upon three main pillars: Recognition, Engagement and Professional Development.
                       




                       Do you want to stay up to date with the latest information from UCR Staff Assembly? We invite you to join our Staff Mailing List. The list is opt-in and you may remove yourself at any time.
                      
                       Enter your name and email below and you will be taken through the subscription process. You will receive a confirmation email to confirm your subscription and as well as information on how to manage your account or unsubscribe.
                      
              900 University Ave.
              
              Riverside, CA 92521

title: The Campaign for UC Riverside
body:
Living the Promise: The Campaign for UC Riverside
              
              Living the Promise — UC Riverside's comprehensive $300 million campaign focused on Social Innovation and Empowerment, From Genomics to Harvest, Renewable Nature, New Voices and Visions, Health and Wellness, and Emerging Technologies.
             

               Play
               
                Living the Promise: The Campaign for UC Riverside
               
               video
              


               Living the Promise: Spoken Word
              
              A spoken word poetry interpretation of “Living the Promise” voiced and written by UC Riverside student Gabby Adoh, featuring the faces of UCR students, faculty, and staff.
             

               Play
               
                Living the Promise: Spoken Word
               
               video
              

            UC Riverside is guided by its land-grant tradition of providing access to an excellent education to generations of diverse college students, giving back to our community, and positively influencing the world. Whether assuring a dependable food supply, stimulating the human soul through the arts, or finding solutions to the profound challenges in education, engineering, business, healthcare, and the environment, UC Riverside is Living the Promise.
           
            The University of California, Riverside serves the needs and enhances the quality of life of the diverse people of California, the nation, and the world through knowledge — its communication, discovery, translation, application, and preservation. The undergraduate, graduate, and professional degree programs; research programs; and outreach activities develop leaders who inspire, create, and enrich California’s economic, social, cultural, and environmental future.
           
            The first comprehensive fundraising effort in UCR’s history,
            
             The Campaign for UC Riverside
            
            will raise money for students, faculty, research, programs, and facilities, and will be driven by campus academic priorities.
           
            Philanthropic support catalyzes excellence allowing UCR to transcend good in favor of great. Gifts to UC Riverside enrich our ability to shape the lives of future generations of leaders and provide a robust teaching and learning experience. There has never been a time in UCR’s history when an investment had such profound potential to impact the future of California.
           


          We’ve set our aim to propel UCR forward into a brighter future, supporting the people who fill this place with powerful knowledge, and have the potential to positively impact our world. Expanding our campus with new buildings and enhancing current facilities will allow UCR to better serve students and support campus growth. Creating scholarships and financial aid opportunities will maintain UCR’s assurance of access and affordability for the deserving, ambitious students who have gained admission to our institution. Naming new centers, programs, and initiatives will advance the progress of UCR student and faculty research, ideas, and inventions.
         

              From Genomics to Harvest:
             
             the basic science, cultivation, and production of plants and food
            

              Learn more
              
               about food
              



              Emerging Technologies:
             
             innovations that enrich how we experience and interact with our world
            

              Learn more
              
               about technology
              



              Health and Wellness:
             
             advances in the study of human health, reducing healthcare disparities, and prevention and wellness
            

              Learn more
              
               about health
              



              Renewable Nature:
             
             the environment, energy, and sustainable development for a healthier planet
            

              Learn more
              
               about sustainability
              



              Social Innovation and Empowerment:
             
             strengthening our social fabric through quality education, robust public policy, and community engagement
            

              Learn more
              
               about community
              



              New Voices and Visions:
             
             expressing and celebrating our humanity through the visual and performing arts, and nurturing voices from across the rich tapestry of society
            

              Learn more
              
               about culture
              



              Student Success:
             
             enhancing opportunity for undergraduate, graduate, and professional students
            

              Learn more
              
               about student success
              



              Research Support:
             
             developing a leading research university for the 21st century through faculty and research support
            

              Learn more
              
               about research support
              


            Producing engineers with the knowledge to serve rapidly-changing technology and conducting cutting-edge research, BCOE is a catalyst for industrial growth in Inland Southern California, the state, and the world.
           
            A combination of the arts, humanities, and social sciences create a unique environment in CHASS to examine diverse dimensions of social and historical life and human meaning.
           
            Evolving out of the Citrus Experiment Station, CNAS brings together the study of agricultural sciences, life sciences, physical sciences, and mathematical sciences for collaboration.
           
            A professional school responsible for linking research, instruction, and service in the field of education, GSOE’s programs help educators at all levels take on today's toughest education challenges.
           
            Preparing students for management and leadership roles in today’s global landscape, the School of Business offers MBA and Ph.D. programs, and the largest undergraduate program in the UC system.
           
            Opened in 2013, this new medical school is educating the next generation of physicians for the medically underserved Inland Southern California region.
           
            Working in partnership with policy makers, entrepreneurs, and business leaders in our own backyard and around the world, SPP faculty and students address complex issues facing growing communities today.
           
           The Highlanders compete in 17 sports at the NCAA Division I level, the highest level of collegiate competition in the country. Proud members of the Big West Conference, a group of nine schools all based within the state of California, the Athletics program at UCR enhances the reputation of the university and provides student-athletes with the opportunity for growth outside the classroom.
          

            Visit Athletics Website
           












            Watch Video
           

           Comprising California Museum of Photography, Sweeney Art Gallery, and The Barbara and Art Culver Center of the Arts on a single city block of downtown Riverside’s bustling Main Street pedestrian plaza,
                            ARTSblock is an internationally-recognized visual and performing arts center that serves as a cultural anchor for the University and the region.
          

            Visit ARTSblock Website
           

           Nestled in the foothills of the Box Springs Mountains on the east side of campus, the UCR Botanic Gardens cover 40 hilly acres, connecting people with nature. As a living classroom without walls, the gardens provide a wide assortment of materials for courses at UCR as well as other local schools in courses ranging from botany and anthropology to entomology and photography. Visitors to campus come to
                            explore the four miles of scenic trails, view our more than 3,500 plant species from around the world — or just relax on a bench and enjoy the beauty.
          

            Visit Botanic Gardens Website
           












            Watch Video
           

           With three million volumes, 28,000 print and electronic serial subscriptions, 1.7 million microforms, 300,000 government information sources, and access to 500,000 e-books, music, and media collections, the UCR Library serves the research and teaching needs of the campus and also serves the community as the regional research library for the Inland Empire.
          

            Visit Library Website
           

          Your gifts benefit the university immediately and provide you, the donor, with immediate tax savings.
         

             If you would like to hand-deliver your gift, please bring it to our office at:
             

             University of California, Riverside
             
             Hinderaker Hall, Suite 1136
             
             900 University Avenue
             
             Riverside, CA
             

             Contact: Lisa M. Wilson, Assistant Director, Gift Administration
             
             Telephone: (951) 827-3486
             
             Gift Administration Office Hours: Monday–Friday, 7:30 a.m.–5 p.m.
            

            Our
            
             online giving page
            
            allows you to easily make a credit card gift or pledge payment.
           
            To make you gift by phone, please call (951) 827-5611.
           
            If you are a UCR employee, you may authorize UCR’s Payroll Department to take a monthly deduction from your paycheck and designate a campus program, school or department to receive your gift.
           
            UCR Foundation
            
             Hinderaker Hall 1136
             
              900 University Ave.
              
               Riverside, CA 92521
              
             
            
           
          Whether you are looking to make a gift now or planning for future giving through bequests in your will, IRA or retirement accounts, charitable annuities or trusts, the Office of Planned Giving can help. Please contact us at
          
           (951) 827-3793
          
          or e-mail
          
           giftplanning@ucr.edu
          
          .
         
          Your annual gift to UCR stays true to the tradition that links all Highlanders: providing support for the student experience and for the research and programs most meaningful to you and to our campus.
         

           Every Gift Matters:
          

          The number of individuals contributing to the university is just as significant as the dollars we raise.  Plus, the more people who make a gift, the more good UCR can do in the world.
         

           Every Year Matters:
          

          Supporting extraordinary students and faculty takes extraordinary resources. The funds provided by annual gifts are spent each year but the important work of preparing leaders, improving lives, and creating art continues year in and year out.
         

           Give Now
          

          Donors who contribute $2,000 or more annually to any school, college, program, or department are invited to become members of The Chancellor’s Associates. Discover the benefits of membership:
          
           donorrelations@ucr.edu
          
          .
         



             University of California, Riverside
            



           900 University Ave.
           
            Riverside, CA 92521
           
          
         
          Tel: (951) 827-1012
         
          Mailing Address:
          
           900 University Avenue, MC063
           
            Riverside, CA 92521
           
          
         
          Physical Address:
          
           1955 Chicago Avenue, Ste. 200
           
            Riverside, CA 92507

           Fax: (951) 827-7311

             giveucr@ucr.edu

title: Tobacco Free: Clearing the Air
body:
Search for:
       



    You are here:
   


       Effective January 2, 2014, the University of California, Riverside joins more than 1,500 colleges and universities nationwide in the adoption of a campuswide smoke/tobacco-free policy.
      





      This policy is being adopted by all University of California campuses, labs and centers to improve the health and safety of all UC students, staff, faculty, patients and visitors.
     
      This policy prohibits the use of cigarettes, e-cigarettes, cigars, snuff, snus, water pipes, pipes, hookahs, chew, and any other non-combustible tobacco product.
     


        Learn more about the Campus Tobacco & Smoking Policy
       




        Download and read a PDF of the Campus Tobacco & Smoking Policy
       


      While the use of tobacco is a personal choice, the health hazards related to smoking and exposure to second- and third-hand smoke are well-documented. These hazards can affect not only the smoker but also the nonsmoker who is exposed to the smoke.
     
      As a leader in healthcare and environmental practices, the university recognizes its responsibility to exercise leadership through the creation of a smoke-free environment for all students, employees, and visitors at all University of California campuses, medical centers and facilities.
      
       Visit the UC Smoke & Tobacco Free Policy website for more information.
      

      In February 2017, a campus-wide survey on tobacco use and smoking was conducted.
      
       View the report on the results of this survey.
      



        The University of California and its partners are pleased to offer assistance to students, staff and faculty who wish to stop smoking.
       


          Learn more about the resources available for people seeking to quit smoking
         


        The success of this policy relies upon the cooperation of both smokers and nonsmokers. The first step of enforcing the policy will be respectfully educating the campus community.
       


          Learn more about how the policy will be enforced and what you can do to help

title: UC Riverside Academic Senate: Home
body:
Search for:
      



      Not currently logged in
     





          Dear Senate Colleagues,
         
          I write to remind you of the upcoming February 26 Division Meeting for the UCR Academic Senate, from 1-3 p.m. in the Genomics Auditorium (1102A).  A full agenda will be coming this week.
         

           (Please note the earlier start time of 1:10pm).
          

          The Special Theme for the Winter 2019 Division Meeting is "Introducing the Underground Scholars Initiative."
         
          The Underground Scholars Initiative has multiple chapters across the UC system, and has gained international recognition.  Founding members have been featured in a “60 Minutes” interview with Oprah Winfrey.  USI’s goal is to build a pathway for formerly incarcerated and system impacted students to access and thrive in higher education.  UCR’s Underground Scholars are contributing to the growth of our campus community by providing a supportive space for formerly incarcerated students to network, organize, and use their educational success as a counter-narrative to the many stereotypes they encounter on a daily basis.
         
          USI members are working closely with schools and community organizations in the Inland Empire that advocate on behalf of formerly incarcerated people and provide them with the necessary resources and opportunities to succeed. USI at UCR is especially dedicated to disrupting the flow of “at-risk” youth between schools and prisons, and provides mentorship programs for children and young adults in the Riverside community to enable their transition to higher education.
         
          I am honored to serve as the faculty co-advisor with Prof. João Costa Vargas (Anthropology) for the new UCR chapter of the Underground Scholars Initiative (USI).  Members of this campus organization have accepted my invitation to discuss USI’s mission at the February 26 Division Meeting:
          

          I hope you will join me in welcoming these students and their new organization to our campus on February 26.
         
          Peace
          
          dylan
         
          Dear Faculty Colleagues,
         
          My thanks to the Basic Needs and Food Insecurity Working Group for speaking to the Special Theme at our December 4, 2018 Division Meeting.  As promised, we are posting their informational slides here:
         

           Basic Needs
          

          Peace
          
          dylan
         
          Dear Faculty Colleagues,
         
          Please take time to examine the full Charge for the General Education Review Committee, linked here.  I look forward to updating the campus on the Gen Ed Com’s progress after it convenes.
         

           Charge
          

          Peace
          
          dylan
         
          Dear Faculty Colleagues,
         
          As I begin my sixth year as Chancellor, I remain as excited about UCR’s future as when I first arrived. The talents and successes of the faculty created our national prominence and are what drew me to UCR in the first place.
         
          While the last five years have been exciting and rewarding, they have not been without their challenges. In response, I have tried to listen to the advice and feedback that I’ve received and adjust my actions as appropriate; but I realize that additional improvements can always be made. It is in that spirit that I write to you, today.
         
          The Academic Senate solicited feedback on my first five years this past Spring. I read the resultant report carefully and am taking the advice that it contained seriously. Moving ahead, I look forward to future consultation with the Senate. I would also offer anyone with advice or perspective on how I might best serve the campus, a personal invitation to share their thoughts with me. A lot has changed in five years and what was apt in 2013 may not be as suitable today. Thus, I would appreciate continuing the dialogue about how I may best engage with all of our campus stakeholders today and beyond.
         
          I am always eager to meet with individuals or groups in person; but would also appreciate e-mails, notes, letters, or any mode that works for you.
         
          I look forward to your thoughts and to continue working on behalf of the university.
         
          Kim
         
          Hi everyone,
         
          I hope you’ve had a solid summer and are ready for the new school year.  I’m back for my 18th year as a UCR faculty member and the start of my second term (and 3rd year) as your Academic Senate Chair.  The most significant project to be undertaken by the Senate (and thus, all of us) in the coming year will be the full review of UCR’s General Education curriculum, including a transformative reflection on our breadth requirements, collective pedagogical mission, and scholarly-intellectual obligations to a student body that is fundamentally different than it was during the last such full review (about 40 years ago!).  I look forward to the debate, creative sharing, and critical thought that will characterize this process.  I believe our work at UCR will be constructively altered by this work.
         
          I have once again made myself available to all departments on campus if you wish to invite me to one of your regularly scheduled faculty meetings.  (I never have an agenda for these visits, other than to re/introduce myself to everyone and engage in a collective conversation about whatever you wish to discuss.)  My email address is
          
           dylan.rodriguez@ucr.edu
          
          and my cell phone number is 951-756-4713.  Please don’t hesitate to reach out if you want to talk for any reason at all.
         
          I am forwarding a few other items of interest below.  I hope all of you will plan to attend the Fall Divisional Meeting of the Academic Senate on Tuesday, December 4, at 1:10 pm in the Genomics Auditorium (Room 1102A).
         
          Peace.
          
          Dylan Rodriguez
          
          Chair of the Riverside Division of the Academic Senate
          
          Professor, Department of Media and Cultural Studies
         

           FROM THE UCR WELLNESS PROGRAM (THE WELL):
          




           FROM THE OFFICE OF THE PROVOST & EXECUTIVE VICE CHANCELLLOR:
          



          Dear Senate Colleagues:
         
          I am pleased to circulate the administration's "Summary White Paper on RUSD STEM High School on the campus of the University of California, Riverside," recieved from PEVC Larive on July 23, 2018. Much thanks to the Committee on Faculty Welfare and various faculty colleagues for initiating this vital and important discussion on a significant prospective project.
         

           Summary White Paper on RUSD STEM High School
          

          Peace,
          
          dylan
         
          Dear Senate Colleagues:
         
          We are indebted to the Committee on Research and Chair Amit Roy-Chowdhury for successfully conducting the Research Support Survey.
         
          We have posted the Survey Report on the Senate's homepage here: (
          
           Report
          
          ), please take a look when you have a moment as it offers campus-wide insight.
         
          I hope you're all having some fun in the early summer.
         
          Peace,
          
          dylan

title: UCR JOBS
body:
UCR strives to accommodate applicants with disabilities. In the event that your disability prevents you from completing the online application process, please contact us so that we can provide options to assist you in completing the application process. Please contact
          

            disabilitymanagement@ucr.edu
           

          or (951) 827-2561 for assistance.
         




            University Advancement
           






         Under the leadership of Vice Chancellor Peter A. Hayashida, the
         
          UC Riverside University Advancement
         
         team raises public awareness of UCR's excellence in research, teaching, and service. We encourage, promote, and secure public and private resources to support:  recruitment and retention of world-class faculty; high-quality education for the best and brightest students who are reflective of California's diverse population; and leading-edge facilities and equipment necessary for inquiry and the creation of knowledge for the 21st century and beyond.
        

          The Office of Alumni & Constituent Relations
         
         serves to preserve and promote the relationships between UCR, its alumni, students and many external constituencies.  Through its various services and programs, the office engages UCR's alumni, students and external constituencies in support of the university and its tradition of excellence.
        

          The UCR Office of Development
         
         is a proud partner with the thousands of alumni, parents, and friends who have chosen to take a key role in shaping the face and future of this rapidly growing campus. The generosity of our donors not only enhances the quality of the UCR educational experience, it helps countless young people attain the skills and knowledge they need to succeed and lead in the 21st century.
        

          The UC Riverside University Communications department
         
         is responsible for creating integrated programs that publicize and support the university's mission of teaching, research and service to audiences through first-person communication, programs, and publications.
        
         University Advancement is committed to hiring and developing employees who want to be a part of a high-performing culture that supports our UCR mission.  Below are some of our current featured jobs:
        




       UCR is central to a thriving city on the rise. Recently name a top city for entrepreneurs by MSN Money (outnumbering better-known tech hub San Jose), Riverside has something for everyone. This new offering by UCR's video team show you why. Enjoy!
      
       The University of California, in accordance with state law and in keeping with its own principles of nondiscrimination, will continue to ensure that its transgender students, faculty and staff have unrestricted access to restrooms that conform to their gender identities. We are heartened to hear that protecting all students, including those in the LGBTQ community, remains a stated priority for the Department of Education.
      
       For the third consecutive year, UC Riverside has been recognized for an outstanding healthy workplace environment by the American Heart Association (AHA) with a Fit-Friendly Employer Platinum recognition and Worksite Innovation Award.
      
       UCR is the recipient of the 2018 American College Health Association (ACHA) Healthy Campus Award and prioritizes the health and well-being of the entire UCR campus community.
      
   UCR received the 2018 Mother-Baby Friendly Workplace Award from the California Breastfeeding Coalition. The campus is committed to providing a lactation support program that promotes breastfeeding support and education to employees and their families, flexible scheduling options for breastfeeding mothers, and a private, comfortable location for milk expression while employees are at work. Please visit the
   
    UCR Lactation Program web page
   
   to learn more about the program and to utilize the services.
  
   UCR is a smoke/tobacco/vape-free campus. Smoking, the use of smokeless tobacco products, electronic smoking devices and nicotine products not regulated by the FDA for cessation is strictly prohibited. For more information about the policy or cessagtion resources, please visit, please visit
   
    tobaccofree.ucr.edu
   
   .
  


     UCPath Center - Career Opportunities
    


   The University of California has launched the UCPath Initiative to create cost savings and administrative efficiencies by providing one single, university-wide system. As part of this initiative, a new UC-wide shared services center (UCPath Center) is being designed that will process routine transactions related to payroll, benefits, leave management and workforce administration. Located in Riverside, California, the UCPath center will provide services across the University of California's 10 campuses and 5 medical centers.
  
   UC employees are encouraged to explore  career opportunities at the UC Path Center. Visit the
   


    UCPath website
   
   to learn more about UCPath and UCPath Center opportunities.
  
   Questions about UCPath Center jobs and recruiting can be sent to
   
    UCPathJobs@universityofcalifornia.edu
   
   .

title: Parents Association | Parents Association
body:
University of California, Riverside
              


                       The support of parents and families plays an integral role in their student’s experience at UCR. The Parents Association is an opportunity for parents to engage with the campus and stay connected with their student. All parents and families of current students are invited to participate.
                      

                        GET INVOLVED
                       

                       The UCR Parents Association values parent participation. There are multiple opportunities for parents and families to get involved.
                      

                        VOLUNTEER NOW
                       

                        Raiko Muhammad is the proud mother of Sabir Muhammad; both look forward to his graduation this Spring. Raiko has remained active throughout Sabir's education. She believes that when parents are involved, their students are more confident and successful. Sabir is a double major in engineering and public policy and will spend a quarter in our nation's capital with the UCDC program. Raiko is determined to stay connected and frequently volunteers with the Parents Association at events such as Highlander Summer Orientation and Homecoming.
                       
                       When you give to UCR you support academic excellence, research, and your student’s journey at UCR.
                      



                         GIVE NOW

University of California, Riverside
              

              Promoting Graduate Education
             







    The UCR Graduate Division provides a range of services to support graduate student success from the beginning of their graduate career, through the duration of their program at UCR, and beyond their degree completion. Our team oversees graduate recruitment, admissions, academic affairs, fellowships, grants, employment, and mentoring. On these pages you will find links to the programs and opportunities hosted by Graduate Division. Please call, email, or come visit for more information.

title: Home | Career Center
body:
University of California, Riverside
              

              Connect • Inspire • Empower
             




                      UCR's Career Center is dedicated to Connect, Inspire and Empower current students and alumni on their career paths. Stop by our state-of-the-art center to take career assessments, videoconference with employers worldwide and connect with mentors. Schedule an appointment with one of our career counselors for career guidance, resume reviews and interview prep. Log in to UCR Handshake or visit a career fair to find internships, part-time and full-time positions.
                     




  Employers: Click to Log into Your Handshake Account
 



  Students & Alumni: Click to Log into Handshake via CAS or (netid)@ucr.edu Account
 
















          See Events Calendar
         

              Draft a professional looking resume or cover letter in just a few short minutes. Several different resume styles and examples are available online.
             

               Read more
              

              Learn all about the search process from our Career experts, including building a network, accessing online resources and what to expect from an employment agency.
             

               Read more
              

              Drop in, call or go online to make an appointment with a career counselor for career guidance.
              


               Read more
              

              Fairs include accounting, engineering, graduate and professional schools, teaching and law. Visit our Fairs page for locations and dates.
             

               Read more
              

              Graduating students are invited to meet on-campus with prospective employers for full-time career positions, including finance, sales, engineering and technology.
             

               Read more
              

              A virtual version of some of our services jam-packed with the kinds of helpful resources needed to find a job or investigate your potential careers.
             

               Read more

title: Botanic Gardens: Home
body:
Search for:
      




         Spotlight on new GIS map
        


        Welcome to the UCR Botanic Gardens! Located in the foothills of the Box Springs Mountains on the east side of the University of California, Riverside Campus, the Gardens covers 40 hilly acres. Come visit our collection and gardens, wander over four miles of scenic trails, or just relax on a bench and enjoy the beauty and vistas.
       
      
       The UCR Botanic Gardens are open daily, 8:00 am to 5:00 pm, except for major holidays, special events, and during UCR campus closure. Gates locked at 5:00 pm.
      
       1 PM Late Opening Days for gardens and facilities maintenance: Late Openings will occur on the 1st and 3rd Fridays of each month.
      
       UCR campus road paving will occur on Big Springs Rd (March 4 - March 18). Please view the
       
        campus map
       
       for alternate routes.
      
        As part of UC Riverside, the UCRBG follows the UCR Academic Calendar, which may be found here:
        
         http://registrar.ucr.edu/registrar/academic-calendar/
        
        .

title: Transportation Services
body:
You are here:
   

       Search for:
      





      Transportation Services is committed to providing innovative and sustainable solutions to efficiently meet traffic and parking demands. Each day, UCR accomodates thousands of students, faculty and staff commuting to campus. Our goal is to get you here safely and efficiently.
     
      Whether you are looking to share a ride, find a place to park your bike, need to purchase a parking permit, pay a citation, or rent a university vehicle, this site will provide you with the information and resources you need.
     


        The University of California, Riverside
       
       (
       
        www.ucr.edu
       
       ) is a doctoral
research university,
a living laboratory for groundbreaking exploration of issues critical to
Inland Southern California, the state and communities around the world.
Reflecting California's diverse culture, UCR’s enrollment is now nearly 23,000 students.
The campus opened a medical school in 2013 and
has reached the heart of the Coachella Valley by way of the UCR Palm Desert Center.
The campus has an annual statewide economic impact of more than $1 billion.

title: Home | Highlander Student Orientation
body:
University of California, Riverside
              


                       During this two-day mandatory orientation, you'll explore UCR's campus and traditions, talk with academic advisors, schedule classes, learn ways to get involved, meet other first-year students and more!
                      
                       Your visa status may prevent you from attending Highlander Orientation.
                      
                           No, Highlander Orientation is not mandatory for F-1/J-1 international students currently located outside of the United States. According to United States immigration regulations you may not enter the United States until 30 days before the start date on your I-20 or DS-2019, so it will not be possible for you to attend Highlander Orientation. For more information, please contact Undergraduate Admissions no later than July 1 at 951-827-3411 or
                           
                            internationalinfo@ucr.edu.
                           

                           Your attendance is required at our Mandatory International Student Orientation event in September. Please be aware that International Student Orientation is a separate and mandatory event for all F-1 and J-1 visa holders. A detailed message about our Mandatory International Student Orientation Program will be sent to your UCR R'mail account in May. Learn more about Mandatory International Student Orientation. Contact International Affairs, International Students and Scholars at
                           
                            internationalstudents@ucr.edu
                           
                           or 951-827-4113.
                          
                           Yes, you are required to attend Highlander Orientation in addition to the Mandatory International Student Orientation in September. For more information, please contact Undergraduate Admissions no later than July 1 at 951-827-3411 or
                           
                            internationalinfo@ucr.edu.
                           

                           Your attendance is expected at both Orientation Programs. Please be aware that International Student Orientation is a separate and mandatory event for all F-1 and J-1 visa holders. A detailed message about our Mandatory International Student Orientation Program will be sent to your UCR R'mail account in May. Learn more about Mandatory International Student Orientation. Contact International Affairs, International Students and Scholars at
                           
                            internationalstudents@ucr.edu
                           
                           or 951-827-4113.
                          

                       There are nine two-day sessions offered throughout July and August. Find the right one for you and enjoy all of the exciting things we have in store!
                      

                        Read More
                       









                       Take the Pledge
                       
                       to Stop Sexual Assault

title: Apply | Undergraduate Admissions | University of California, Riverside
body:
Explore UCR!
                 

                   Schedule a campus tour
                  

                 or take a
                 

                   virtual tour
                  

                 today.
                

               University of California, Riverside
              

                          Wherever your journey started, you will find a home at the University of California, Riverside (UCR). You will be embraced by a diverse community of students and faculty who are driven by heart, and who will help you turn your passion into purpose!
                         
                          Follow your heart to UCR and take your place at one of the most highly ranked and respected universities in the world. UCR stands proud as one of 10 schools within the prestigious UC system, and honors a heritage of world-class academic excellence.
                         



                            UCR is America’s fastest-rising ranked university.
                           


                            (
                            
                             U.S. News & World Report, 2019
                            
                            )
                           



                            No. 35 public university in the United States.
                           


                            (
                            
                             U.S. News & World Report, 2019
                            
                            )
                           


                            As a member of the world’s most-prestigious public university system, UCR ranks among the top 1 percent of universities worldwide.
                           


                            (Center for World University Rankings, 2018–19)
                           


                            UCR’s distinguished faculty boasts two Nobel Laureates and 10 members of the National Academies of Science and Medicine.
                           


                            Ranked the 13th best university in the western United States, UCR leads the nation in excellence, access and affordability.
                           


                            (
                            
                             Money Magazine, 2018
                            
                            )
                           


                            Located in the 10th most-populous county in the United States and California’s fastest-growing region, UCR is an economic powerhouse, contributing $2.7 billion to the U.S. economy.
                           


                            (2017 UCR Economic Impact Report)
                           




                            Your success is our top priority. Ease into college life with help from faculty, peer mentors and first-year learning communities. Get a tutor at the Academic Resource Center (ARC). Feel at home with eight Ethnic & Gender Programs. “Finish in Four” to receive your degree with a sooner-than-later return on your investment. We’ll even connect you to employers on campus and around the world.
                           
                            UCR’s distinguished faculty — including two Nobel Laureates and 10 members of the National Academies of Science and Medicine — will mentor you to think deeper, reach further and make a positive change in the world. Find your purpose with
                            
                             150+ undergraduate majors
                            
                            . Get the competitive edge for jobs and/or graduate school with unique undergraduate research.
                           
                            Students boost study-life balance with fun, friends and exploration. Work out at the state-of-the-art Student Recreation Center (SRC). Go camping at Yosemite or scuba diving at the beach with our Outdoor Excursion trips. Meet up with like-minded people from 450+ student organizations. Join the student body at one of our campus music festivals with featured artists such as Lil’ Uzi Vert, DJ Snake and Kendrick Lamar.
                           
                            UCR students do good in the world. They find common ground on a campus that includes students from nearly every state in the nation and over 75 countries. They support one another and give back to their communities. In fact, UCR is ranked No. 3 in the nation for producing the most altruistic/community service-minded students. (
                            
                             Pillrs.com
                            
                            , 2017)
                           

                         A UC degree is more affordable than you might think! Grants, scholarships, loans and work-study are offered to qualified students by our
                         
                          Financial Aid
                         
                         office.
                         
                         Offering Californians one of the most generous financial aid packages in the nation, UCR is the 13th best university in the western United States. (
                         
                          Money Magazine
                         
                         , 2018)
                        

                           of UCR
                           
                            undergraduate students
                           
                           received some form of financial aid.
                          


                           of UCR
                           
                            transfer students
                           
                           received some form of financial aid.
                          


                           of those who received financial aid have their full fees covered by grants and/or scholarships.
                          

                            Experience all that awaits you at UCR! Explore our park-like campus with an
                            
                             individual or family walking tour
                            
                            led by a student guide. Get an inside view of labs, housing options and popular hangouts with our
                            
                             360-degree virtual tours
                            
                            . Let us know if you’re visiting California, and we will give you a personalized campus tour and share more about the UCR student experience.
                           
                            We also invite you to join us for
                            
                             campus events and special open houses
                            
                            . Tour the campus, connect with faculty and current students, explore majors, and find out about financial aid.
                           
                            Located just 60 miles (96 km) east of Los Angeles, the city of Riverside is a multicultural hub for arts and culture in Inland Southern California. It offers average temperatures of 75 degrees (26.3 C), as well as quaint neighborhoods, world-class shopping, international foods, theaters and museums, sporting events, and cultural festivals.
                           


                              Forbes
                             
                             ranked Riverside as one of The Best Places for Business and Careers (2017), and
                             
                              Business Insider
                             
                             included the city on its list of 10 US Cities Where Everyone Wants to Live Right Now (2017).
                            


                         Our students are driven by heart. They give back and they do good in the world. Now it's your turn!
                         
                         Follow your heart to UCR. We'll welcome your passions and support your dreams.
                        







                     ADMISSIONS
                    




                     COST
                    




                     MAJORS
                    




                     DATES/DEADLINES
                    




                     VISIT
                    




                     EVENTS

              Riverside, CA 92521

                 This information is accurate and reliable at time of posting, but may change without notice. Please contact Undergraduate Admissions for the most up-to-date information.
                
                 Campus Security and Crime Report
                
                 The "Jeanne Clery Disclosure of Campus Security Policy and Campus Crime Statistics Act" commonly referred to as the "Clery Act," requires institutions of higher education receiving federal financial aid to report specified crime statistics on college campuses and to provide other safety and crime information to members of the campus community. The report is available on the Institutional
                 
                  Ethics and Compliance website
                 
                 . If you would like a printout containing this information, you can contact the Clery Act Compliance Coordinator via email at
                 

                   magaly.perez@ucr.edu
                  

                 or by phone at
                 
                  (951) 827-5747
                 
                 .

title: Home | Office of Diversity, Equity & Inclusion
body:
University of California, Riverside
              



                       The Office of Diversity, Equity and Inclusion is committed to the urgent, sustained, and comprehensive work of creating a campus climate of mutual respect and communal vision at the University of California, Riverside. This work belongs to every member of our community and includes ensuring greater representation of individuals from all backgrounds in every part of the university and keeping fairness and accessibility in higher education at the heart of our policies and procedures. We value a deep, collective understanding that an institutional and personal commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion is a true commitment to meaningful, lifelong learning.
                      






                        Give here to help UCR students study abroad
                       

              900 University Ave.
              
              Riverside, CA 92521
